data.author: Adrian-Stanea
data.message:
CHANGELOG.rst: first time release

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

data.author: Adrian-Stanea
data.message:
Automated Hardware Testing Infrastructure (#12)

* ci: setup test workflow on self-hosted runner

- System tests that require HW to run are now
  executed on a self-hosted runner which needs
  access to a Pluto SDR device.

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* ci/tests: improve test workflow with formatted log output

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* .github/tests: change self-hosted runner

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* .github/test.yml: fix test-reporter action workir issue

- The action fails if a valid git working directory is not set.

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* CMakeLists: extend timeout for iio_ros2 tests

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

* package.xml: added scipy test dependency

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

---------

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

data.author: Adrian-Stanea
data.message:
examples/ad5592r: added actuator node

- This example demonstrates how to develope a ROS2 node
that uses the adi_iio node services to interface with
the AD5592R device. It exposes topics which in turn
control the channels via service calls.
- Control can be done via manual writes to the topic
or using the state machine node.

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

data.author: Adrian-Stanea
data.message:
Change loop_rate to support fractional values

Previously, loop_rate was limited to integer values, restricting the Rate
object to whole-second intervals. By changing the data type to double, we
enable fractional  rates, allowing the Rate object to sleep for
intervals longer than 1 second or for precise fractional durations.

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

data.author: Adrian-Stanea
data.message:
adi_iio: use services in parallel via callback_groups

- The multithreaded executor allows to run multiple services in parallel.
Having each service in a separate callback group means that each service
can potentially run in parallel with other services.

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

data.author: Adrian-Stanea
data.message:
IIOBuffer: limit thread to a maximum loop_rate

- The loop_rate will control how often the thread will run.
The value is expressed in Hz. If the IO operation takes longer
then the actual loop_rate will be lower then the requested value.

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

data.author: Adrian-Stanea
data.message:
IIONode: added timeout parameter to the node

- Control the timeout for long running buffer operations
such as buffer readings.

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>

data.author: Adrian-Stanea
data.message:
scipts/hooks: add wrappers for pre-commit checks and fixes

- Checks will log errors and warnings but won't block the commit
- Fixes will try to apply changes that allow checks to pass - these
need to be executed manually
- cpplint and uncrustify are used as warning but wont block the commit
  even if it fails (the code still compiles and runs)

Signed-off-by: Adrian-Stanea <Adrian.Stanea@analog.com>
